DataElement.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Beam Equipment Name Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A name identifying  the type of diagnostic radiation therapy beam.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Radiation Therapy Beam Treatment Equipment Name
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles._A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment._A manufactured object that is used to perform diagnostic, therapeutic or research activities._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/18/19 jk DICOM CDE; Released per qtrly metric review.  12/10/13 created for a Norton CC DICOM RT study. jc

ValueDomain.preferredName: Diagnostic, Therapeutic, or Research Equipment Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A manufactured object that is used to perform diagnostic, therapeutic or research activities._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A proprietary, robotic radiosurgery system designed to deliver precise beams of high does radiation to tumors with extreme accuracy.

Concepts.definition: A proprietary, robotic radiosurgery system designed to deliver precise beams of high dose radiation to tumors with extreme accuracy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of external beam radiation therapy in which the radiation is delivered slice-by-slice, providing sequential delivery of radiation to different parts of the tumor. This method differs from other forms of radiation therapy in which the entire tumor volume is irradiated at one time.

Concepts.definition: A type of external beam radiation therapy in which the radiation is delivered slice-by-slice, providing sequential delivery of radiation to different parts of the tumor. This method differs from other forms of radiation therapy in which the entire tumor volume is irradiated at one time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A machine that creates high-energy radiation to treat cancer, using electricity to form a stream of fast-moving subatomic particles.  Also called mega-voltage (MeV) linear accelerator or a linac.

Concepts.definition: A type of particle accelerator that generates ionizing radiation by colliding subatomic particles traveling at high speeds along a straight chamber. This creates high-energy radiation that may be used to treat cancer.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity.
